sentence: Speaker, here we are, likely one of the very last floor debates  of the year, and Republicans have decided to use it to eliminate  healthcare for millions of Americans, not by accident, but because they  simply don't care, because they are clueless.

sentence: This agenda to strip healthcare for millions and raise healthcare  costs for tens of millions is not what the American people are  clamoring for, I can assure you.

sentence: But it is not too late for a few Republicans--and it only takes a  few: four in the House, four in the Senate--to step up and say they  don't want to be part of this, if they will stand up and say: No, we  will not risk the healthcare for millions of Americans as bargaining  chips for billionaire tax breaks.

sentence: There is a lot to unpack  there and a lot of talk about playing games, but what my colleagues on  the other side of the aisle refuse to admit is how during the COVID-19  pandemic they had intentionally passed premium tax credits with a  sunset allowing them to expire and, in the process, playing politics  with the healthcare of millions of Americans.
